{
    "covered": "- Accidental loss or damage to your car caused by incidents such as hail, storm (including cyclone), flood, fire, theft or attempted theft, malicious damage or vandalism, collision, and impact (Comprehensive, Comprehensive Extras, and Comprehensive Advantages cover)
- Legal liability for damage to other people’s property arising from the use of your car
- Accidental loss or damage to your car caused by fire and theft (Fire, Theft & Third Party Property Damage cover)
- Up to $20 million for damage to other people’s property due to Third Party Property Damage cover
- Additional covers such as hire car after theft (up to 21 days), emergency accommodation, tools of trade cover, transport cover, towing and storage costs, replacement of baby capsules or child seats, and trailer cover (depending on the level of cover)
- Coverage for damage by uninsured drivers (limited to $5,000 for repairs to your car)
- Optional covers such as windscreen and window glass cover, hire car after an event for unlimited days, and Suncorp Roadside Assist",
    "not-covered": "- Any structural, mechanical, electrical or electronic failure or breakdown of the car
- Damage caused by alcohol or drugs to the driver
- Damage caused by driving a car that is unregistered, unsafe, or un-roadworthy
- Intentional or deliberate acts causing damage
- Loss or damage that occurs outside Australia
- Damage caused by motor sports or similar activities
- Replacement of non-damaged parts
- Refund of premium upon cancellation of the policy under specific circumstances
- Any costs incurred due to negligence or failing to inform the insurer about significant changes during the policy period",
    "additional-info": "- A cooling-off period of 21 days during which you can cancel the policy for a full refund (conditions apply)
- The excess payable on claims may vary depending on circumstances such as the age of the driver or previous claims history 
- Policy limits, conditions, and exclusions may apply and are specified in different sections of the PDS
- Special conditions may apply to the policy which can restrict or extend covers and are specified on the certificate of insurance
- Policy documents may be communicated electronically
- Additional support for individuals facing financial or personal difficulties is available upon request",
    "gotchas": "- Claims may be reduced or denied if the policyholder has not met specified responsibilities, such as maintaining the car in a roadworthy condition
- The insurer's ability to cover costs is limited to the amount shown on the certificate of insurance, not exceeding policy limits
- Claims for hire car costs require prior consent from the insurer
- If a driver under 25 was at fault, additional excess may apply
- The policy may be voided if the car was unregistered or if proper procedures were not followed after an incident (such as notifying the police or the insurer in a timely manner)
- If finding or recovering a stolen car takes longer than 14 days, the car is deemed a total loss and the coverage terms change"
}

{
    "covered": "- Rectification of common breakdown problems (e.g. inflation of a flat tyre, jump-starting a flat battery)
- Replacement of a flat tyre with a serviceable spare
- Delivery of fuel when the car runs out, up to a maximum value of $10
- Jump-starting of flat batteries or arranging a replacement battery if available
- Assistance with lost or locked keys, including delivery of spare keys, up to a maximum of $250
- Towing of the vehicle up to 20km to the nearest accredited repairer (or up to 100km if no repairer is within 20km)
- Transporting a caravan or trailer in case the car towing it breaks down",
    "not-covered": "- Cars that are unregistered or not roadworthy
- Unattended cars unless organized at the time of the assistance request
- Cars not registered for Roadside Assist in their system
- Vehicles involved in racing or motor sports
- Modified or oversized vehicles requiring specialist towing
- Taxis, limousines, rental or hire cars
- Cars that are immobile in a workshop for repairs
- Cars in restricted access areas where entry is not permitted
- Cars in locations inaccessible by a two-wheel drive recovery vehicle
- Service calls due to accident damage, break-in, or negligence (e.g. running out of fuel, lack of maintenance)
- Breakdown caused by incorrect fuel, prior faults, or not following manufacturer's recommendations
- Breakdowns due to issues with attached caravans or trailers",
    "additional-info": "- You must remain with your car after calling for assistance, or payment may be required for subsequent call-outs.
- There is a 24-hour waiting period after purchasing or adding roadside assistance before coverage starts for breakdowns.
- Costs for repairs and any parts needed after a breakdown are the responsibility of the car owner.
- Transfer or cancellation of the Roadside Assist benefit is not possible once purchased; it is linked to the specific car.",
    "gotchas": "- If the assistance is requested in an inaccessible location, service may not be provided.
- Certain extraordinary circumstances like extreme weather may prevent service from being delivered.
- If a car is found to be modified or inappropriately maintained, it may disqualify the coverage even if the breakdown is unrelated to those issues.
- The maximum coverage for lost key assistance is capped at $250; further costs might incur for key replacement or cutting.
- The interpretation of 'reasonable care' may be subjective; failure to demonstrate this could invalidate a claim."
}

{
    "covered": "- Accidental loss or damage to your boat during the period of insurance, including hail, storm (including cyclone), fire, theft, and collision.
- Legal liability for death or bodily injury to other people or damage to their property arising from the use of your boat (Comprehensive cover).
- Legal liability for third parties in the use of your boat (Third Party cover).
- Pollution by oil, fuel, or waste following an incident, subject to limits.
- Salvage and removal costs when your boat is stranded, sunk, or burnt.
- Emergency expenses to minimize further loss or damage.
- Replacement for a new boat hull, motor, or trailer if total loss occurs and items are less than 2 years old.
- Travel costs if stranded due to an incident, capped at $500.
